3: 【kuroname】, do you have a moment?
Regarding both of the two separated consciousnesses, though minute, they both display stability decrease over time.
Whether it's because of the effect of Tenebrion or something else, this kind of continuous decline is not a situation we'd like to see.
The only solution we have right now, is to send Camu back to Kamui's frame occasionally, while keeping a close eye on them.
We believe this will re-stabilize both consciousnesses.
As for Kamui...
Commaaandaaant!
Kamui's large head pops up in front of Asimov and fills the entire screen.
Commandant! What happened on the surface? I was here when I woke up! Where's my Capt.? And Camu, too! I can't talk to him! Where's the guy?!
This incessant chatter and seemingly brainless barrage of questions... Very Kamui.
As you can see, he's the same as before.
To be honest, I was also surprised at the results of the surgery. Tenebrion might have helped him recover, or not... But well, there he is, now.

Then, because he kept nagging the others to get him back to the park, we all decided he should be shoved in the next transport plane and sent over. Any problems that arise, we'll deal with them as they come.
Right after hanging up, Nanami and Sophia catch you.
Commandant! Look at this!
Putting aside where the two found this outfit, how did they manage to get Camu to wear it? It must have been the battle of the centuries...
Nanami is saying that...
Aah! Shh!
Then, as if realizing something, Camu turns and leaves.
He looks angry.
T-then bye, we'll be going! Have fun playing, Commandant!
You might have just been overwhelmed by this stream of events, but you find Camu's expression a little off.
...And with this, the memory transfer process is over. You should be waking up now.
What's going on here?
Don't panic, it's just an electromagnetic restraint. I'm talking to you through the airdrop cabin's private channel.
You people can stop being so wary of me. I'm not about to make enemies of you.
Same here.
If you don't believe me, just let me out on the surface, and I'll find a way to live on my own.
We've indeed considered such an option... But this isn't something that we wish to do.
Instead, our recommendation is that you temporarily join Gray Raven and work together with 【kuroname】.
No freedom, if I don't work with Babylonia, huh...?
No, you're not working with Babylonia. Please learn the difference.
You're working with 【kuroname】.
He's awake?
You can give him the talk. I'm just a technician. Not my field.
In the hologram in front of Camu, Asimov packs up the scattered equipment and data, then leaves the lab.
President Hassen... Big fish, eh?
'Course. You need a big fish for recruiting someone with a big bite.
Right?
...Cut the bootlicking.
No, this is the reality we are dealing with now.
You are the last piece of the puzzle in my plan.
Now, Babylonia's counterattack can finally take shape.
But if you're not willing, I won't force you. I'll unchain you, and you can walk out.
But, if you choose to leave, you will no longer be authorized to know about Gray Raven and Kamui.
You will have nothing to do with them for the rest of your life. Well, I'm sure you can find the means to keep your mind in order and survive, even with just yourself.
...Explain your proposition. Clearly.
You hide something, I'll rip your head off.
Naturally. Let's begin.
Commaaandaaant!

2: You're still so full of energy.

3: YEP! Of course, I'm the ENERGY MAN!
Camu? Oh... right! Where's the guy?
Camu's gone missing! Commandant! Camu's missing!
...Aw shucks.
If he hates this kinda atmosphere, then he'll likely find some place to hide...

2: Do you know where he is?

3: Well... I'm not sure either.
But with Camu, hmmm, maybe...
Probably not that far away, taking it out on the Corrupted because he's mad or something, maybe—
Another swing of his weapon lands. Only corpses and silence remains on the beach.
...Phew.
Finally. Feeling better now.
Camu casually tosses aside his weapon—an unfortunate Corrupted—and plants himself smoothly on the beach.
Come out. I see you.
...Do you Babylonians all have issues?
I'll be leaving this place next, and joining the Ascendants.
After all, the tekkie said that I'm more an Ascendant or Corrupted, than a Construct.
...You serious?
We won't be talking so peacefully the next time we meet.

2: You're not going to settle that score?

3: Hah, it's as Kamui said. Not fooling you, huh?
I'm going to try to believe in Kamui for now... This might not be so bad, I guess.
What why? I'm part of 'them' now, aren't I?
...? Are you a 'why' robot?
You're just like what Kamui said. An interesting weirdo.
Camu shows a rare thoughtful expression.
...Well, I guess I can afford staying here a little longer.
I don't like the crowd, but I'm a little interested in the 'ice cream' thing that Kamui mentioned.
